comments.body:
Thank You.
Sorry for the late Thank you.
I thought I had posted one when you did it.

comments.author: Lawton Campbell.8517
comments.body: We just regenerated the tiles; the updated ones should appear in a couple of days as the CDN caches expire.

comments.author: Reincarnated.1754
comments.body:
Lawton Campbell.8517:
Reincarnated.1754:

It looks to me like, they have made an adjustment in the game map of Tyria, for Rata Sum area.
And have not done the same adjustment for the copy in the tile service.

That’s certainly possible, but I’m really not familiar enough with how that endpoint works. How is the current result different from the expected result?

This is how I think it is:

Imagine the map of Tyria as one giant Image, call this the master image.
To make this master image of all of Tyria, someone has pasted each playable map (i.e. Queensland, Kessex Hills ect.) onto this map in is relevant location.
Then a copy of the master map has been taken for use in the game.
Also a copy of the map has been taken to make the tiles in the Tile Service.
Some one has noticed the error of the placement of Rata Sum in the copy taken for the In Game Map and adjusted it.
But the copy taken for making the tiles in the Tile Servce has not been altered.

I hope that made some sense.

comments.author: Reincarnated.1754
comments.body:
smiley.1438:

Seems fine to me: http://gw2.chillerlan.net/examples/gw2staticmaps.php

continent_rect: [[4608,19710],[7168,22270]]

:) The size of the tiles are ok.

It’s hard to explain.
You need to make a map using the tiles, then populate it with the POI, i.e. Waypoints.
compare the location of the web based map and the game map.
